title: 6 tough job interview questions that force a candidate to be brutally honest
text:
Josh Spector is an audience growth strategist, creator of the For The Interested newsletter, and publisher of the Newsletter Accelerator course.

He works with a wide range of clients ranging from The Oscars, to individual creators, entrepreneurs, and small businesses. He previously ran digital media and marketing for The Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences.

He says that most job interviews are a waste of time; good hiring can come from asking the right questions. Candidates should show their understanding of the job they're interviewing for.

Interviewers should learn what types of jobs candidates are looking for, how committed they are to learning, and what they're excited about doing.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Most job interviews are a waste of time.

That's because most interview questions simply invite candidates to regurgitate their resume or offer generic answers about how their biggest weakness is that they "care too much" or "work too hard."

Josh Spector. Courtesy of Josh Spector

No wonder hiring is so hard.

The key to hiring talent is to ask questions that reveal a candidate's true intent, approach, and skill set.

Here are six questions I use to do that …
description: Candidates should be following smart people in the industry, and show a commitment to continual learning.
